title: Romantic Valentine single-page experience with dodging “No” button and success cat image

requirements.text: Create a single full-screen Valentine page (no navigation) with a romantic pink-and-white theme, asking the user to be the creator’s Valentine and presenting two options: “Yes” and “No”.

quotes:
Create an interactive web page as a surprise for my boyfriend... ask him to be my Valentine.
There should be two options: Yes or No.
... themed romantically with a pink and white color scheme

acceptanceCriteria: The app shows one full-viewport page with a romantic pink/white styling (background, typography, spacing) and no additional pages or navigation elements.
The page clearly asks the Valentine question and shows two buttons labeled “Yes” and “No”.
Layout is responsive and usable on iPad-sized viewports in Chrome.

requirements.text: Implement the “No” button to evade interaction: when the pointer hovers over (or touches) the “No” button, it moves to a different location so it cannot be clicked.

quotes: When he hovers her cursor over No, it should move away so he cannot click it, forcing her to click only on Yes.

acceptanceCriteria: On pointer hover (mouse/trackpad), the “No” button relocates before it can be clicked.
On touch devices, the “No” button also relocates on touch start/attempted interaction.
The “No” button stays within the visible bounds of the viewport (does not move off-screen).

requirements.text: When the user clicks “Yes”, replace the question UI with a success view that shows the text “Good choice” and displays a cute couple-cat image.

quotes:
When he  clicks Yes, show him a cute cupels cat 
image telling him
"Good choice

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking “Yes” transitions to a new view/state without page reload.
The success view includes the exact user-facing text: “Good choice”.
A cute couple-cat image is displayed on the success view.

requirements.text: Add the required generated image(s) as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them directly from the frontend (do not proxy through the backend).

quotes: show him a cute cupels cat image

acceptanceCriteria: The generated image file(s) exist under frontend/public/assets/generated.
The success view loads the image via a static path from the frontend and displays it reliably in the browser.

constraints: Use English for all user-facing text.
Frontend must be implemented using React + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS within the existing Caffeine template.

Do not edit files in immutable paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
No backend functionality is required for this feature (no persistence, no canister state).
nonGoals: Multi-page routing or additional site sections beyond the single Valentine interaction.

required: Cute couple cats illustration in a romantic style (couple-cats.dim_1024x1024.png)
